speaker: Bloggers
vclaim: NASA has discovered a new planet covered in marijuana.
date: stated on February 4, 2019 in a story:
title: No, NASA didn't discover a new planet covered in marijuana.
text: The cannabis fans may have been lured into an online story that claimed that scientists had discovered a new planet fully covered in marijuana. Unfortunately, that is not the case. The story was published on February 4, in the Ehalthdigest.org blog, at least since May 2015. The story was highlighted as part of Facebook efforts to combat false news and misleading information in its broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) Let's be clear: No, NASA didn't discover a planet covered in marijuana. If something like this happens, it will be national news and not just a cliché report on some mysterious blogs. Facebook was published on January 11, 2021 in the Facebook newspaper Nancy Belusi, no longer the Speaker of the House of Representatives by Samantha Buterman: January 12, 2021, the story has been broken over and over again. The planet that is supposed to be discovered - planet X637Z-43 - has its own trick page in Wikipedia. The article attempts to make the prosecution appear to be a little more reliable but short in several areas, especially when quoting Harvard astronomer David Sharpono to say: "Imagine if it takes 140 years to travel from one planet to another, let's just say it's gonna be a very long journey. You'd better have put yourself some joints for the road." We contacted Sharponayo, but we didn't hear an immediate response. That's all on the pants on the fire! Sharing facts 2019-02-08 18:09:48 UTC PoliticsFact 1 1 7 PoliticsFact Rating: Pants on Fire NASA discovered a new planet covered by marijuana on the Internet on Monday, 4 February 2019 2019-02-04 Read more information
